Recap: Lily gets released from the hospital and is irritated to see Jade looking after he kids. She feels trapped into keeping Jade around because of Luke's health. Luke has reservations about what they are doing to his parents, but Jade wants him to lighten up. They head over to Crash and when Luke won't, she jokes with him about pretending she is Kevin. Luke tells her to go to hell and leaves. Will and Jade have an unpleasant run in again after Maddie tells him about Jade's history. Nick drives Carly home after she drinks too much at the opening of Crash; they find some common ground. Gwen's band is reunited thanks to Casey; they take the stage and everyone loves them. Maddie and Will seem to fight feelings as if they are in the way with Casey and Gwen's opening. Mike worries about what the future holds since they found the skeleton; Katie is angry he wants to postpone the wedding, but they later make up as they tell Margo they are moving the wedding up to this coming week. Paul tries to keep Emily from jumping off the side of the cliff to no avail. Meg, Dusty, Hal and Paul fight to keep Emily alive, but when it seems she has died, the only one who won't give up on her is Paul, as he continues giving her CPR and she is revived. Dusty thinks there is an ulterior motive to why Paul wants Emily alive. Emily holds on at the hospital as Paul begs her to forgive him.
Transcript: Lily: I feel silly in this chair.
Holden: Every patient gets the ceremonial wheel-out, you know that.
Lily: Yeah, when are the discharge papers gonna be ready?
Holden: The nurse said to stay put. There's no rush.
Lily: Yeah, easy for her to say.
Holden: And you know what? Don't scare me like that again.
Lily: Oh, I'm fine. I haven't had a contraction in days.
Holden: You know what? I got a way to combat that high blood pressure.
Lily: Are you gonna send Jade to Mars?
Holden: No. I'm prescribing lots of bed rest and a couple of full body massages.
Lily: Oh, well, who's gonna watch the girls while you treating me like royalty?
Faith: Mommy!
Lily: Hi!
Jade: I told you we'd see Mommy.
Luke: We took the girls to the spring fair at Faith's school.
Lily: How was it?
Jade: Incredible.
Holden: And who's the artist?
Faith: Jade.
Jade: They told me that Lily signed up for a spot at the face painting booth, so I took your spot. I didn't think you'd mind.
Holden: No, no, no, no.
Lily: Yeah, you have a hidden talent.
Jade: For smiley faces and rainbows. But, Luke took a lot of pictures. You should show her.
Holden: How tell me, how much cotton candy did you have? A lot?
Luke: Here, Mom, check this out. This is Faith coming out of the moon bounce.
Jade: Natalie, they let me go in with her and we went halfway to Mars.

Nick: Steady.

[Carly laughing]
Carly: Ouch! Somebody moved that chair.

Carly: Uh-huh.

Carly: And I'm sticking to it. Don't you want to go back to the party?

Nick: You're right. They're not. I'll see ya.
Carly: They're at a neighbors for a sleepover.

Carly: Not at the moment, no.

Carly: No and obviously I'm not driving anyplace because my car's at the Crash place in the parking lot.
Nick: I'll pick that up for you in the morning.
Carly: No, no, Nick, I can do it. Believe it or not, most days I am pretty good at running my own life.
Nick: Yeah, I can see that, Carly. Bye.
Carly: But, wait -- I'm sorry. Don't go.

Meg: Okay, get your coat over her. Okay, just be careful, don't move her. Keep her still.

Meg: I can't get a pulse.

Lisa: Hello, may I have your attention please. So many of you have asked me where did I get the idea for this club. Well, it's very simple. I just wanted people to feel welcome when they come here and well if you love rock and jazz and blues, soul music. And if you're young, if you're not so young, if you're a local people or if you're out of town. My grandson says, well there's nothing more fun than just crashing a party. And that's what I want you to do. That's what this club is all about. I want you to feel like you can come right in that door, and crash our party every night. Now, there's something very special. This is our opening night, the grand opening, and we have a wonderful, wonderful young singer who is going to crash onto the music scene. And so I have asked her if she would be happy to sing for us and she said yes, she would. So put your hands together and give a nice, warm welcome to Gwen Munson and her band, the Krew.
Gwen: Thanks, Mrs. Grimaldi. Ok, wow. Yeah, three, four --

Susan: You're the reason she was up there in the first place! You're the reason that she felt like her life was not worth living. I hope you got a good look at my daughter tonight, at how in pain she is and full of despair. How much this man has brought it into her life because someday he's gonna do it to you!
